results.title: Acute neurovascular unit protection by simvastatin in transient cerebral ischemia.
results.text_hl: Acute neurovascular unit protection by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ in @<m>DISEASE_Ischemic_Attack_Transient</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002546 @@@transient cerebral ischemia@@@.

citations.NLM: Nagaraja TN, Knight RA, Croxen RL, Konda KP, Fenstermacher JD. Acute neurovascular unit protection by simvastatin in transient cerebral ischemia. Neurol Res. 2006 Dec;28(8):826-30. PMID: 17288739

results.title: Pharmacology and clinical experience with simvastatin.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ is effective at reducing total mortality, @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@, coronary mortality and the incidence of @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ or @<m>DISEASE_Ischemic_Attack_Transient</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002546 @@@transient ischemic attack@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Coronary_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003327 @@@coronary heart disease@@@ and @DISEASE_Hypercholesterolemia @DISEASE_MESH:D006937 @@@hypercholesterolemia@@@.

citations.NLM: Hess DC, Fagan SC. Pharmacology and clinical experience with simvastatin. Expert Opin Pharmacother. 2001 Jan;2(1):153-63. PMID: 11336576
citations.BibTeX: @article{11336576, title={Pharmacology and clinical experience with simvastatin.}, author={Hess DC and Fagan SC}, journal={Expert Opin Pharmacother}, volume={2}, number={1}, pages={153-63}}

results.title: Fast assessment of stroke and transient ischaemic attack to prevent early recurrence (FASTER): a randomised controlled pilot trial.
results.text_hl: METHODS: Within 24 h of symptom onset, we randomly assigned, in a factorial design, 392 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Ischemic_Attack_Transient</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002546 @@@TIA@@@ or minor @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ to @CHEMICAL_Clopidogrel @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077144 @@@clopidogrel@@@ (300 mg loading dose then 75 mg daily; 198 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@) or placebo (194 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@), and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (40 mg daily; 199 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@) or placebo (193 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@).

citations.NLM: Kennedy J, Hill MD, Ryckborst KJ, Eliasziw M, Demchuk AM, Buchan AM, FASTER Investigators. Fast assessment of stroke and transient ischaemic attack to prevent early recurrence (FASTER): a randomised controlled pilot trial. Lancet Neurol. 2007 Nov;6(11):961-9. PMID: 17931979
citations.BibTeX: @article{17931979, title={Fast assessment of stroke and transient ischaemic attack to prevent early recurrence (FASTER): a randomised controlled pilot trial.}, author={Kennedy J and Hill MD and Ryckborst KJ and Eliasziw M and Demchuk AM and Buchan AM and FASTER Investigators}, journal={Lancet Neurol}, volume={6}, number={11}, pages={961-9}}

results.title: RApid Primary care Initiation of Drug treatment for Transient Ischaemic Attack (RAPID-TIA): study protocol for a pilot randomised controlled trial
results.text_hl: With regard to @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ lowering, there was no evidence of benefit of early administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ in the pilot FASTER trial, which comprised @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with a @<m>DISEASE_Ischemic_Attack_Transient</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002546 @@@TIA@@@ or minor @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ within 24 hours of onset who had been admitted to hospital.

citations.NLM: Edwards D, Fletcher K, Deller R, McManus R, Lasserson D, Giles M, Sims D, Norrie J, McGuire G, Cohn S, Whittle F, Hobbs V, Weir C, Mant J. RApid Primary care Initiation of Drug treatment for Transient Ischaemic Attack (RAPID-TIA): study protocol for a pilot randomised controlled trial Trials. 2013 Jul 2;14():194. PMID: 23819476

results.title: HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors (statins): a promising approach to stroke prevention.
results.text_hl: The best current evidence for @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ prevention is with @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@. @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@Pravastatin@@@ reduces the risk of @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@coronary artery disease@@@ and average @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ levels; @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ reduces the risk of the combined endpoint of @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Ischemic_Attack_Transient</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002546 @@@transient ischemic attack@@@ in hypercholesterolemic @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@coronary artery disease@@@.

citations.NLM: Hess DC, Demchuk AM, Brass LM, Yatsu FM. HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors (statins): a promising approach to stroke prevention. Neurology. 2000 Feb 22;54(4):790-6. PMID: 10690964
citations.BibTeX: @article{10690964, title={HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors (statins): a promising approach to stroke prevention.}, author={Hess DC and Demchuk AM and Brass LM and Yatsu FM}, journal={Neurology}, volume={54}, number={4}, pages={790-6}}

results.title: Atorvastatin: its clinical role in cerebrovascular prevention.
results.text_hl: A post hoc analysis of data for 3280 @DISEASE_Heart_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D006331 @@@HPS@@@ study participants who had had a previous @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ revealed that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ reduced major vascular events by 20% (p = 0.001).The SPARCL study assessed the secondary preventive efficacy of @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ versus placebo in 4731 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with a history of @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ or @<m>DISEASE_Ischemic_Attack_Transient</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002546 @@@transient ischaemic attack@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Ischemic_Attack_Transient</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002546 @@@TIA@@@), but without @DISEASE_Coronary_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003327 @@@CHD@@@.

citations.NLM: Gaspardone A, Arca M. Atorvastatin: its clinical role in cerebrovascular prevention. Drugs. 2007;67 Suppl 1():55-62. PMID: 17910521
citations.BibTeX: @article{17910521, title={Atorvastatin: its clinical role in cerebrovascular prevention.}, author={Gaspardone A and Arca M}, journal={Drugs}, volume={67 Suppl 1}, pages={55-62}}

results.title: Dual Antiplatelet Therapy Prior to Expedited Carotid Surgery Reduces Recurrent Events Prior to Surgery without Significantly Increasing Peri-operative Bleeding Complications.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: A daily Rapid-Access @<m>DISEASE_Ischemic_Attack_Transient</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002546 @@@TIA@@@ Clinic was introduced in 2008, where symptomatic @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ were started on 75 mg @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@aspirin@@@ + 40 mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ by the referring doctor, before attending the clinic.

citations.NLM: Batchelder A, Hunter J, Cairns V, Sandford R, Munshi A, Naylor AR. Dual Antiplatelet Therapy Prior to Expedited Carotid Surgery Reduces Recurrent Events Prior to Surgery without Significantly Increasing Peri-operative Bleeding Complications. Eur J Vasc Endovasc Surg. 2015 Oct;50(4):412-9. PMID: 26283034
citations.BibTeX: @article{26283034, title={Dual Antiplatelet Therapy Prior to Expedited Carotid Surgery Reduces Recurrent Events Prior to Surgery without Significantly Increasing Peri-operative Bleeding Complications.}, author={Batchelder A and Hunter J and Cairns V and Sandford R and Munshi A and Naylor AR}, journal={Eur J Vasc Endovasc Surg}, volume={50}, number={4}, pages={412-9}}

results.title: Effects of cholesterol-lowering with simvastatin on stroke and other major vascular events in 20536 people with cerebrovascular disease or other high-risk conditions.
results.text_hl: In addition, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ reduced the numbers having @<m>DISEASE_Ischemic_Attack_Transient</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002546 @@@transient cerebral ischaemic attacks@@@ alone (2.0% vs 2.4%; p=0.02) or requiring carotid endarterectomy or angioplasty (0.4% vs 0.8%; p=0.0003).

citations.NLM: Collins R, Armitage J, Parish S, Sleight P, Peto R, Heart Protection Study Collaborative Group. Effects of cholesterol-lowering with simvastatin on stroke and other major vascular events in 20536 people with cerebrovascular disease or other high-risk conditions. Lancet. 2004 Mar 6;363(9411):757-67. PMID: 15016485

results.title: Statins in the 21st century: end of the simple story?
results.text_hl: In @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Coronary_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003327 @@@coronary heart disease@@@ and relatively high @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ decreased mortality, hospital stays, the risk of undergoing @DISEASE_Reinfection @DISEASE_MESH:D000084063 @@@myocardial re-vascularisation@@@, @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Ischemic_Attack_Transient</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002546 @@@transient ischaemic attack@@@.

citations.NLM: Doggrell SA. Statins in the 21st century: end of the simple story? Expert Opin Investig Drugs. 2001 Sep;10(9):1755-66. PMID: 11772284

results.title: [Value and role of lipid lowering therapy for cardiovascular prevention in the elderly].
results.text_hl: However, there is a non significant trend to reduction of @<m>DISEASE_Ischemic_Attack_Transient</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002546 @@@transient ischaemic attacks@@@.
